attributes.action: Shops can help society by offering similar and reasonable prices for basic needs
attributes.additional_details: Same basic foods like flour or bread have very different prices in different shops. At least they can fix a price or set a reasonable price range for some of these basic foods. This means some companies will make less profit but they will help their customers. With the current situation vulnerable people are walking further to find available or cheaper food because of their budgets or availability of foods. With this solution they can go to nearer shops and spend less time outside. Thank you all
attributes.background: Government & Parliament advice that all shops to offer a discount or similar price range for basic needs like bread, flour and eggs. They may advice  a price range to basic need for a reasonable time period like 3 months. After everything finishes we can say"We are So Glad We Had This Time Together"

rejection.details:
The price of consumer goods is a matter for individual producers and retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to restrict people stockpiling and reselling items at inflated prices, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303070

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
